content:
Aviation played a significant role in the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan, with the United States and other coalition forces relying heavily on air support for both ground operations and logistical support. 

In both wars, aircraft were used for a variety of purposes, including reconnaissance and surveillance, transportation of troops and equipment, aerial bombing and strafing of enemy positions, and airstrikes against high-value targets. Unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs), or drones, were also extensively used for intelligence gathering and targeted killings.

In addition, aviation played a crucial role in the evacuation and medical treatment of wounded soldiers, with aeromedical evacuation teams transporting thousands of injured personnel to medical facilities in Iraq, Afghanistan, and other countries.

Overall, aviation played a key role in the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan, providing important support to ground troops and contributing to the eventual outcome of both conflicts.
